content.question: The temperature F, in degrees Fahrenheit (<math> <mo>°</mo> </math>F), of a cup of coffee t minutes after it is poured is given by <math> <mrow> <mi>F</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mn>72</mn> <mo>+</mo> <mn>118</mn> <msup> <mi>e</mi> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>0.093</mn> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> </math>. To the nearest degree, what is the average temperature of the coffee between t = 0 and t = 10 minutes?

topic.text: 8.1: Finding the Average Value of a Function on an Interval

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
